alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Elbert County through 945 PM MDT... At 915 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Deer Trail, or 29 miles northwest of Limon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Agate. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
